channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Pepe’s sudden drop leaves whale 500k in the red
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: A memecoin whale who purchased roughly $3 million worth of the Pepe token just days ago is now sitting on an unrealized loss of around $600,000.

item.title: ‘Bitcoin is not under attack:’ BTC maxis allay fears of a DoS offensive
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: Concerns circulated on Crypto Twitter of a denial of service (DoS) attack on the Bitcoin network.

item.title: Binance halts Bitcoin withdrawals for the second time in 12 hours
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: The crypto exchange said it temporarily closed BTC withdrawals due to a “large volume of pending transactions.”

item.title: ‘No other options’: Hong Kong moving forward with crypto licensing, FinTech chair says
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: Neil Tan, chair of the FinTech Association of Hong Kong, says the opening of the financial industry to digital assets is “just a natural progression.”

item.title: You can now create a shitcoin in less than 23 seconds
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: A new "speedrun" video shows how anyone can create a brand new cryptocurrency in less than 30 seconds.

item.title: 5 cryptocurrencies with the best upside potential in the week ahead
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: Bitcoin and Ethereum’s ETH are finding buyers at lower levels, which may be a bullish sign for XMR, OKB and RPL.

item.title: Binance closes BTC withdrawals amid congestion on the Bitcoin network
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: The Bitcoin mempool was clogged with over 400,000 transactions waiting to be processed on May 7.

item.title: What is a Wells notice, explained
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Onkar Singh
item.description: A Wells notice is a letter from the SEC indicating possible enforcement action against a person or a firm.

item.title: The Ethereum Foundation just sold $30M in Ether — But will ETH price fall this time?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Yashu Gola
item.description: Ethereum Foundation’s previous big sale of ETH preceded a bear market, but there’s little evidence that such sales affect the general market trend.

item.title: Deloitte integrates blockchain for digital credentials
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.description: The credentials will “have multiple use cases,” including regulatory compliance for banking and decentralized finance, age verification for e-commerce, private logins and fundraising.

item.title: Stripe tackles ‘cold start problem’ with the launch of fiat-to-crypto on-ramp
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.description: Web3 companies can utilize the Stripe-hosted fiat-to-crypto on-ramp to allow customers to buy crypto at the “precise moment they need it.”

item.title: Memecoin sends BTC fees to the moon, miner profits top $50B and more: Hodler’s Digest, April 30-May 6
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Editorial Staff
item.description: Memecoin hype fuels Bitcoin transaction costs, BTC miners block rewards surpass $50 billion and AI’s “Godfather” warns of technology dangers.

item.title: Kazakhstan collected $7M in crypto mining taxes in 2022
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Crypto miners paid millions of dollars in energy fees last year following the regulation of mining activities.

item.title: Quadratic funding: The future of crowdfunding, explained
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jagjit Singh
item.description: Quadratic funding is a new approach to crowdfunding that incentivizes smaller contributions and promotes the funding of diverse, high-quality projects.

item.title: Watch these Bitcoin price levels next as BTC dips 3% in choppy weekend
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Some swift down moves fail to make Bitcoin dislodge a familiar trading range, with one trader calling it “in limbo.“

item.title: DEUS Finance loses $6M following stablecoin hack
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: The attacker targeted the BNB Smart Chain and the Arbitrum network, with CoinMarketCap data showing the DEI price dropping 30% following the security incident.

item.title: Bitcoin trader eyes $63K BTC price for new Bollinger Bands ‘breakout’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: BTC price action is shaping up to repeat a rare Bollinger Bands breakout, which only happens once per halving cycle, data suggests.

item.title: US Justice Department investigating Binance for violating Russian sanctions: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The DOJ’s national security and crime divisions are both looking at the cryptocurrency exchange’s provision of services to Russians, Bloomberg reports.

item.title: How ChatGPT can help with personal finance management
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Alice Ivey
item.description: ChatGPT offers personalized advice on budgeting, investing, debt management, savings and retirement planning.

item.title: How to check an Ethereum transaction
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Deer
item.description: To check an Ethereum transaction, use a blockchain explorer and enter the transaction hash to view details such as sender/receiver addresses and gas fees.

item.title: SEC issues record whistleblower award of $279M
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: The $279 million figure is more than all of the whistleblower awards issued for 2022, with the SEC dishing out $229 million across 103 awards last year.

item.title: Nifty News: Pudgy Penguins signs with WME, Bitblox to make Web3 gambling games and more
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: Palm NFT Studio has also launched a new tool via Epic Games’ Unreal Engine, enabling creators to make generative “game-ready” 3D assets and art collections.

item.title: Eligible Celsius users can withdraw all 'Distributable Custody Assets' following court approval
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Certain Celsius users, largely those who only ever held funds in custody accounts, had previously been limited to withdrawing up to 94% of their funds.

item.title: Argentina's central bank halts cryptocurrencies from payment apps
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: The ban is intended to reduce Argentina's payment-system exposure to digital assets, said the monetary authority.

item.title: Crypto Biz: Hyperinflation and Bitcoin wagers, AI replacing first jobs and more
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: This week’s Crypto Biz explores the latest wild wager on Bitcoin prices, inflation fears and the jobs that artificial intelligence may soon replace.

item.title: Liquid staking solutions now have more TVL than DEXs: Finance Redefined
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: April was a month of hacks, exploits and rug pulls, resulting in over $100 million in net losses across DeFi platforms.

item.title: RFK Jr. elaborates position on CBDC, crypto: ‘It isn’t just criminals who want privacy’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The U.S. presidential candidate has added anti-CBDC to his anti-establishment, anti-vaccination repertoire and has gained double-digit support among Democrats.

item.title: Artists face a choice with AI: Adapt or become obsolete
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Hector Ferran
item.description: Art generated by artificial intelligence is making waves because of its ramifications — for originality, authorship, and authenticity.

item.title: Tim Cook says Apple will weave AI into products as researchers work on solving bias
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.description: The Apple CEO said the company would “continue weaving” AI into its products as internal research indicates an emphasis on building unbiased AI systems.

item.title: BNP Paribas teams up with Bank of China to promote digital yuan usage
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: The partnership will enable BNP Paribas China’s corporate clients to make payments using the digital yuan through an e-CNY management system.
